channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MDEPLOY-211] uniqueVersion broken (if not supported, should be removed from doc, and warning printed)
item.project: Maven Deploy Plugin (Moved to GitHub Issues)
item.description:
Doc on 1. http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-deploy-plugin/usage.html as well as 2. http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-deploy-plugin/deploy-file-mojo.html as well as 3. http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-deploy-plugin/file-deployment.html (link "Disable timestamps suffix in an artifact", currently broken!) currently mentions a uniqueVersion.

This appears to be broken at least with Maven v3.3.9. For example, if I do:

$ mvn deploy:deploy-file -Durl=file:///tmp/system -DrepositoryId=some.id -Dfile=target/hello-impl-0.1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar -DpomFile=pom.xml -DuniqueVersion=false
[INFO] Scanning for projects...
[INFO]                                                                         
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Building hello-impl 0.1.0-SNAPSHOT
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- maven-deploy-plugin:2.8.2:deploy-file (default-cli) @ hello-impl ---
Downloading: file:///tmp/system/org/opendaylight/vorburger/hello/hello-impl/0.1.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml
Uploading: file:///tmp/system/org/opendaylight/vorburger/hello/hello-impl/0.1.0-SNAPSHOT/hello-impl-0.1.0-20160618.170929-1.jar

Note hello-impl-0.1.0-20160618.170929-1.jar despite -DuniqueVersion=false.

If this possibility has been removed, as I have the feeling it has been from posts incl. MDEPLOY-44 (that was about adding uniqueVersion to deploy just like, supposedly, it is on deploy-file; this is about it not even working on deploy-file, anymore), then before you close this as WONTFIX, I would argue this current half removal is confusing to say the least ..

If this is not coming back, then the uniqueVersion configuration should be fully removed from maven-deploy-plugin, and the documentation in at least 3 places referred to above should be cleaned up accordingly.
item.summary: uniqueVersion broken (if not supported, should be removed from doc, and warning printed)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Can you give a real use case where this is needed?

http://blog2.vorburger.ch/2016/06/maven-install-into-additional.html has some background; it's in the context of a Maven repo isolated from ~/.m2/repository for (only) OSGi bundle JARs for Apache Karaf. As described in that blog post, mvn deploy is not required (mvn install is fine; MINSTALL-126 is an enhancement request for install).

This bug merely suggests that the uniqueVersion configuration probably should be fully removed from maven-deploy-plugin, and the documentation in at least 3 places referred to above should be cleaned up accordingly.

First yes the documentation needs to be cleaned up. This will be done with 3.0.0 release of the plugin which is in preparation.
You seemed to be misunderstanding the intention of ~/.m2/repository. The intention is simply a cache nothing more. And this gives you the impression that it behaves wrong which it doesn't. Deployment/Installation etc. to an OSGi environment should be done differently via Maven Tycho or bndtools but not via maven-install-plugin nor via maven-deploy-plugin either.
I just ran into this as well; it seems like it's not just the docs that need to be cleaned up, the deploy-plugin itself declares this parameter and then throws away its value.

Should the uniqueVersion parameter of the deploy-file goal be completely removed, or first deprecated (adding code to break the build if used) and then removed in a later release? Since the next release is currently the major upgrade to 3.0.0, we could maybe remove it directly, and add a note in the index of the site.

I personally don't see any value in going through a deprecation-then-remove flow, given that uniqueVersion has apparently never done anything. If anyone is using that parameter thinking that it does something, may as well help them understand that that's not the case sooner rather than later.
The code and the docs have been cleaned up in r1769339. Furthermore, any attempt to use uniqueVersion will fail the build.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build maven-plugins #7598 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/maven-plugins/7598/)
MDEPLOY-211 uniqueVersion broken (if not supported, should be removed from doc, and warning printed)

The parameter uniqueVersion in the deploy-file goal isn't supported since Maven 3, so it is removed from the code base and from the documentation of the plugin. A check is made to fail the build if it is still used, and the index page mentions the removal. (gboue: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/?view=rev&rev=1769339)
